javadoc:
Interface for ComponentProviders to implement if they support basic navigation and selection
 capabilities.  Implementing this interface will provide the provider with navigation history
 and actions that require navigation or selection. (Search Text, Search Memory, Select bytes,
 Select instructions, etc.)

methods.name: goTo
methods.comment: Commands this navigatable to goto (display) the given program and location

params.name: location
params.comment: the location in that program to display

return.comment: true if the goto was successful

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current location of this Navigatable
@return the current location of this Navigatable
methods.name: getLocation
methods.comment: Returns the current location of this Navigatable

return.comment: the current location of this Navigatable

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current Program of this Navigatable
@return the current Program of this Navigatable
methods.name: getProgram
methods.comment: Returns the current Program of this Navigatable

return.comment: the current Program of this Navigatable

methods.javadoc:
Returns the view state for this navigatable
@return the view state for this navigatable
methods.name: getMemento
methods.comment: Returns the view state for this navigatable

return.comment: the view state for this navigatable

methods.javadoc:
Sets the view state for this navigatable.  This is used later to restore the view state.
@param memento the state of this navigatable
methods.name: setMemento
methods.comment: Sets the view state for this navigatable.  This is used later to restore the view state.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an icon that represents this Navigatable
@return the icon
methods.name: getNavigatableIcon
methods.comment: Returns an icon that represents this Navigatable

methods.name: isConnected
methods.comment:
Returns true if this Navigatable is "connected".  Navigatables are connected if they
 produce and consume location and selection events.

methods.javadoc:
Currently only the 'connected' windows support markers
@return true if this navigatable supports markers
methods.name: supportsMarkers
methods.comment: Currently only the 'connected' windows support markers

return.comment: true if this navigatable supports markers

methods.javadoc: Tells this provider to request focus.
methods.name: requestFocus
methods.comment: Tells this provider to request focus.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this provider is visible
@return true if visible
methods.name: isVisible
methods.comment: Returns true if this provider is visible

methods.javadoc:
Tells this Navigatable to set its selection to the given selection
@param selection the selection to set.
methods.name: setSelection
methods.comment: Tells this Navigatable to set its selection to the given selection

methods.javadoc:
Tells this Navigatable to set its highlight to the given highlight
@param highlight the highlight to set.
methods.name: setHighlight
methods.comment: Tells this Navigatable to set its highlight to the given highlight

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current selection of this Navigatable
@return the current selection of this Navigatable
methods.name: getSelection
methods.comment: Returns the current selection of this Navigatable

return.comment: the current selection of this Navigatable

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current highlight of this Navigatable
@return the current highlight of this Navigatable
methods.name: getHighlight
methods.comment: Returns the current highlight of this Navigatable

return.comment: the current highlight of this Navigatable

methods.javadoc:
Adds a listener to be notified if this Navigatable is terminated
@param listener the listener to be notified when this Navigatable is closed
methods.name: addNavigatableListener
methods.comment: Adds a listener to be notified if this Navigatable is terminated

params.name: listener
params.comment: the listener to be notified when this Navigatable is closed

methods.name: removeNavigatableListener
methods.comment: Removes a listener to be notified if this Navigatable is terminated.

params.name: listener
params.comment:
the listener that no longer should be notified when this Navigatable is 
        closed.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this navigatable is no longer valid, false if it is still good
@return true if this navigatable is no longer valid, false if it is still good
methods.name: isDisposed
methods.comment: Returns true if this navigatable is no longer valid, false if it is still good

return.comment: true if this navigatable is no longer valid, false if it is still good

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this navigatable supports highlighting
@return true if this navigatable supports highlighting
methods.name: supportsHighlight
methods.comment: Returns true if this navigatable supports highlighting

return.comment: true if this navigatable supports highlighting

methods.name: setHighlightProvider
methods.comment: Set the highlight provider for the given program

methods.name: removeHighlightProvider
methods.comment: Removes the given highlight provider for the given program

name: Navigatable
comment:
Interface for ComponentProviders to implement if they support basic navigation and selection
 capabilities.  Implementing this interface will provide the provider with navigation history
 and actions that require navigation or selection. (Search Text, Search Memory, Select bytes,
 Select instructions, etc.)
